Take time to learn from others, that’s what stewardship is, and in financial stewardship we can take lessons on financial discipline from successful people. Learning to save, spend wisely, manage your money and grow your wealth are all traits of the financial steward.

When we show discipline with what has been committed to us, we take steps towards becoming financial stewards. After all, it is in taking care of the small things that bigger things are bestowed on us.
On today’s edition of #NavigatewithIdy, we looked at ‘Understanding Financial Stewardship’ – the simple act of being accountable and responsible.

You can initiate transactions with two pages if you dial the codes straight. There are shortcodes for that: Buy Airtime*945*phone Number*amount#Send Money*945*beneficiary account number*amount#Balance Enquiry*945*0#Change PIN*945*00#Get your Account Number*945*000#

The interbank charge is instantly taken. The ussd charge is on how many pages are used. Airtime recharges and balance inquiries also count. We suggest customers use another network if to get debited via airtime and also to get the Alat app if they do not want such charges. -U.S
Using the app does not give you debit for ussd
He gave a scenario and we explained based on the hypothetical case. Balance enquiries and airtime recharges also count. The number of pages opened to consummate a transaction also count. -U.S

If you need further explanation, follow me @uchemichael. Thank you for your time

Here at Wema, we have a number of support initiatives, from the BOI and DBN on-lending schemes where we have disbursed funds in tens of billions to a large number of SMEs, to our MSME offerings such as ExpressCredit and MyBusinessSupport.

In closing, I would say to every young or budding entrepreneur that it is a tough road. But it is also a worthwhile read. I have been privileged to see a good number of entrepreneurs make it. You also can. Yes You Can
The most positive use of funds is to buy raw materials to build a product for existing customer orders. In fact, customer orders are great collateral.

ELIMINATE YOUR SALARY FROM THE USE OF FUNDS Most startup founders don’t take a salary for the first year or two since most investors as well as bankers won’t give you money so that you can pay yourself.
However, if you are a startup operating out of your garage or boys-quarters, you are likely too early in the cycle to get banks interested.
CONDUCT MEETINGS AT YOUR SITE, NOT AT THE BANK You have an advantage if you can get the Analyst on your turf to have a look around and get a better ‘feel’ of your business.
even if not intimately related to the current proposal.

DEMONSTRATE EXPERIENCE IN STARTING A BUSINESS, IDEALLY IN THIS DOMAIN Bankers like investors to an extent, fund people rather than ideas. In some instances, your idea alone will not get you a loan, but your experience running businesses may get you a loan,
Analysts would typically ask for a minimum of six months of positive cash flow.

Analysts however actually prefer to see that you have a revenue stream to repay the loan. Banks are also not primarily in the business of selling pledged collateral so try to avoid granting a loan solely because there is collateral.

DEMONSTRATE AN ABILITY TO REPAY FROM REVENUES, NOT COLLATERAL As discussed earlier, there is usually a need to have collateral to back the loan, like movable assets, cash, debenture on assets, shares or property. Finance

SHOW A SIGNIFICANT PERSONAL INVESTMENT (EQUITY) Most loan analysts want to see that you have ‘skin in the game’. If you have nothing at risk, your own level of commitment is suspect. As a general rule, your investment should be at least 20% of the total projected loan requirement
This is just common sense, since every loan has a repayment schedule, and your credit history reflects your track record of paying prior loan obligations on time.
CLEAN UP YOUR CREDIT RATING BEFORE YOU APPLY Good credit ratings with both the Government CRMS or private credit bureau, both personal and business, are essential to getting a loan or line of credit
Pay particular attention to the financials, and have a professional (chartered accountant, banker, etc. Have a friend of your review for reasonableness before presenting.

Now let’s discuss some tips and rules of thumb to improve your odds and help you understand when a bank loan is possible, and how to get it: WRITE A GOOD BUSINESS PLAN FIRST Approaching a banker without a business plan, and asking for money, is a sure way to be rejected
Here at Wema Bank, in addition to the above, we also have several Cashflow Lending products such as ExpressCredit and MyBusinessSupport for SMEs with some level of established cash flow.

Now because the provision of traditional collateral is almost always a key challenge for SMEs, the Government has introduced the Movable Assets Collateral Registry, which allows for use of movable assets such as vehicles, stock, other floating assets, intellectual rights, etc.

This then means that the collateral pledged should generally be outside of the main source of repayment. In other words, it refers to assets pledged by the obligor to the bank to hedge in part or whole, the exposure of the bank

COLLATERAL Many entrepreneurs do not like to hear this but this is a key consideration. Collateral is a valuable item taken as a safeguard in case the facility cannot be paid back from the primary source.

You need to clearly define your competitive business strategy that will lead to your success despite the competition. “Me-too” businesses are very unlikely to get financial support; rather try to differentiate your offering so as to have a competitive advantage.

DON’T FORGET THE COMPETITION There is no business without competition, except maybe a parastatal. A bankable business plan analyzes the competition, both local and foreign, and how you will succeed in the midst of it.

you don’t have to be skilled in everything. You just need to ensure that your management team possesses the essentials skills: technical, marketing, people management, financial, etc. that will be needed in your business.
For example, if you want to start a computer repair business, have your done the course or had the working experience in this field?

DO YOU HAVE A COMPETENT TEAM? Businesses largely succeed or fail on the strength of the leader and the management team. Are you skilled in the essential areas necessary for the success of your business?
Find out the market size and what share you are most likely to garner. Simple market research will help you come up with some level of realistic figures.

IS THERE A MARKET FOR THE PRODUCTS OR SERVICES? How big is the potential market? If a few families express a desire to buy a couple of chickens from you in a week, that does not justify your plans for a 2,000 chickens a month business.

I would advise us to start focusing more on getting customers before seeking funding. Traceable written orders or commitments to buy your products or a clear gap in the market will make your business plan more bankable.
Solid proof will do a lot to support your case. This can be in the form of previous customers who have bought your initial samples and have expressed the wish to continue buying more.
DO YOU HAVE AT LEAST ONE CUSTOMER? § Entrepreneurs are enthusiastic about their own products. But is there anyone out there who wants and is able to pay for your product?

These samples were not written in Nigeria and therefore do not take into account current Nigerian circumstances. The business idea will look more like a gambling project and it will be hard to get anyone to bet on it.
Some business proposal writers oversimplify the proposal, probably by copying and pasting from free samples off the internet or from proposals done by other people for other lines of business.
IS YOUR IDEA VIABLE? Can the project be executed, legally, are the resources available or being sought, within the time frames stated?
Below are some things Finance Analysts typically look out for:
And this trust must never be betrayed.

Entrepreneurs also need to understand the caution exercised by banks as the funds being availed as loans belong not to the bank (it is not a share of national cake either), but to other depositors who have placed these funds with the banks in trust.

This is not an ideal situation as SMEs are indeed the bedrock of any growing economy. In my experience though, some startup founders do overcome these odds, but you need to be realistic and do your homework.

Some realities we need to come to terms with are that a number of banks don’t avail loans to startups because the failure rate is just too high, and startups typically don’t have the assets or revenue stream to back up the loan.

At Wema, we have availed financing running into tens of billions on both schemes to SMEs and MSMEs. A number of requests have also been turned back due to false or unrealistic business proposals presented.
or from Government initiatives such as the Bank of Industry (BOI) or Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN) schemes for SMEs and Youths, are not professionally done and thus not bankable.

A number of existing and potential entrepreneurs have asked me what makes some business proposals get funded while many are rejected. Before giving the reasons, I usually advise that it is unfortunate that the vast majority of business proposals submitted seeking funds from Banks

There is a popular sentiment that banks don’t understand customers’ needs or that getting a bank loan is usually a strenuous and exhausting experience. Another is that banks ask for an arm and a leg before granting loans. I am sure a number of entrepreneurs can relate to this.

Having featured on songs with other Nigerian artists which include Good Man by eLDee, an offshoot from a campaign “Violence against women”, Aramide has worked and shared the stage with notable Nigerian and International artists. #SWA #CantStopWontStop

She also won the award for Alternative Artist of The Year award at the 2016 edition of the Nigerian Entertainment Award (NEA) and Best Vocal Performance (Female) Category at the 2015 edition of the Headies Award. #SWA #CantStopWontStop

Aramide was the winner of the Best Alternative Song for her single "Funmi Lowo" at the 2018 edition of the Headies Award, Best Female Artist in West Africa at the 2016 edition of the All Africa Music Awards (AFRIMA). #SWA #CantStopWontStop
Her debut album SUITCASE was released in November 2016 and she has performed at the various events in Nigeria, Ghana, United Kingdom, Dubai, United States and Canada. #SWA #CantStopWontStop

Her musical influences include Erykah Badu, Miriam Makeba, Sade, Angelique Kidjo and other greats. Her song-writing is echoed by a soft but deep and powerful voice, accompanied with the rhythmic sounds of the saxophone and guitar. #SWA #CantStopWontStop

Our #WCW, @AramideMusic is a Multi-Award Winning Nigerian Afro-Soul/Jazz artiste and a Recording Academy (Grammy) voting member. She sings about love, betrayal, friendship, trust, and the attendant joys and aches of womanhood.

We need to uplift ourselves and work together as a team because we are definitely stronger together. #Songersationwitharamide #aramide #BalanceforBetter #IWD #Swa

Songversation’ was coined from ‘song’ and ‘conversation’ which means while we enjoy good music, let's also have uplifting conversations, let’s talk on topics that try to build and push women towards their goals. We need to help ourselves.

Songversation with Aramide is my quota in supporting women, that’s why it holds in women’s month.’ Although the concert is open to both men and women, it gives women in different fields the opportunity to connect and have conversations.

But today, I’m glad the narrative is gradually changing, women can speak up and our voices will be heard. I’m glad women can successfully attain positions without questions, filling strategic positions in politics and other spheres of life getting the appreciation we deserve.

We asked Aramide what inspired Songversation, here’s what she said: I started Songversation With Aramide to support and celebrate women. There was a time when women were underappreciated, our voices were always silenced, our actions were ignored even when we tried

Alat is recognised by banks in Nigeria. Any bank that fails to recognise Alat will still acknowledge Wemabank its parent bank. Erroneous transfers require consent from the receiver of the money via his bank for the funds to be removed from his account back to yours.
